definitions: the quality of being able to be believed; credibility

examples.text: the internet is overflowing with various conspiracy theories with extremely disparate levels of believability
editors have an obligation to provide readers with the information needed to judge the believability of articles they read

shortDefinitions: quality of being convincing or credible

definitions: (with reference to a fictional character or situation) the quality of being convincing or realistic

examples.text: the plot lacks believability at certain key moments
it builds the believability of a character when the actor dresses the part

shortDefinitions: quality of being convincing or realistic
